About:
Informations about continous rate infusions based on the DIVI recommendations.
These informations are used in the PerfuRate Application available for Android.
Source: "Empfehlungen zu Standardkonzentrationen für die kontinuierliche Infusion auf Intensivstationen"

MedicationData.Name: Alteplase
MedicationData.Description: Stroke IV: 0.9 mg/kg total (max 90 mg), 10% bolus, remainder over 60 min. PE: e.g., 100 mg over 2 h. Catheter-directed: ≤ 2 mg per instillation.

MedicationData.Name: Argatroban
MedicationData.Description: Therapeutic anticoagulation: start 2 µg/kg/min with titration to aPTT 1.5–3.0× baseline. Reduced doses for hepatic impairment.

MedicationData.Name: Clonidine
MedicationData.Description: IV/infusion: perfusor starting ~0.5 µg/kg/h with slow titration.

MedicationData.Name: Dexmedetomidine
MedicationData.Description: ICU sedation infusion: typically 0.2–1.4 µg/kg/h; maximum recommended 1.4 µg/kg/h.

MedicationData.Name: Dobutamine
MedicationData.Description: Inotropic support: commonly 2.5–10 µg/kg/min; range 2.5–20 µg/kg/min, titrate to effect.

MedicationData.Name: Norepinephrine
MedicationData.Description: Vasopressor for shock: start 0.05–0.1 µg/kg/min, titrate to MAP; common range 0.05–2.0 µg/kg/min.

MedicationData.Name: Furosemide
MedicationData.Description: Adults: initial IV 20–40 mg; may escalate to 80–160 mg or higher in refractory cases. Pediatric: ~1–2 mg/kg/day.

MedicationData.Name: Glyceroltrinitrate
MedicationData.Description: IV infusion: commonly 0.5–10 mg/h; SCAPE protocols may use 5 mg/h titratable up to ~15 mg/h short term.

MedicationData.Name: Midazolam
MedicationData.Description: IV procedural sedation: 1–5 mg IV titrated. ICU sedation: 0.02–0.1 mg/kg/h.

MedicationData.Name: Propofol
MedicationData.Description: Maintenance: 4–12 mg/kg/h for anesthesia; lower for sedation.
